fusilli.evalÔÉÅ

Functions for evaluating the performance of the models and plotting the results.

Plotting class for comparing models.

Parent class for all plot classes.

classmethod from_new_data(model, params, data_file_suffix='_test')[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

data_file_suffix (str) ‚Äì Suffix for the data file e.g. _test means that the source files are params["tabular1_source_test], params["tabular2_source_test], params["img_source_test]. Change this to whatever suffix you have chosen for your new data files.

classmethod from_final_val_data(model_list, kfold_flag)[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • model_list (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of models. Keys are the model names and values are [[model]*num_k]

  • kfold_flag (bool) ‚Äì Whether the models are kfold models or not.

classmethod kfold_comparison_plot(comparing_models_metrics)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plotting function for comparing models on kfold metrics. Produces a violin plot.

Parameters:

comparing_models_metrics (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of metrics. Keys are the model names and values are dict {metric1name: metric_value, metric2name: metric_value}

Returns:

fig ‚Äì Figure containing the violin plots.

Return type:

matplotlib figure

classmethod train_test_comparison_plot(comparing_models_metrics)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plotting function for comparing models on train and test metrics. Produces a horizontal bar chart.

Parameters:

comparing_models_metrics (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of metrics. Keys are the model names and values are dict {metric1name: metric_value, metric2name: metric_value}

Returns:

fig ‚Äì Figure containing the horizontal bar chart.

Return type:

matplotlib figure

__init__()[source]ÔÉÅ
classmethod get_new_kfold_data(model_list, params, data_file_suffix, checkpoint_file_suffix=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Putting new data into each k-fold trained model: we don‚Äôt need to split the new data into folds. We just need to get the predictions for each fold and plot them.

classmethod get_new_tt_data(model, params, data_file_suffix, checkpoint_file_suffix=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Get new data by running through trained model for a train/test model.

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) ‚Äì The trained model.

  • sources (list) ‚Äì List of sources to get data from. [tabular1source csv, tabular2source csv, image csv]

  • params (dict) ‚Äì Additional parameters.

  • data_file_suffix (str) ‚Äì Suffix that is on the new data csv and pt files. e.g. ‚Äú_new_data‚Äù or ‚Äú_test‚Äù

  • checkpoint_file_suffix (str, optional) ‚Äì Suffix that is on the trained model checkpoint files. e.g. ‚Äú_firsttry‚Äù. Added by the user. Default is None.

Return type:

return train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds, metric_values

classmethod get_tt_data_from_model(model)[source]ÔÉÅ

Get the data from a train/test model.

Parameters:

model (nn.Module) ‚Äì The trained model.

Returns:

  • train_reals (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The real values for the training set.

  • train_preds (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The predicted values for the training set.

  • val_reals (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The real values for the validation set.

  • val_preds (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The predicted values for the validation set.

  • metric_values (dict) ‚Äì The values of the metrics for the model.

class RealsVsPreds[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: ParentPlotter

Plots the real values vs the predicted values for a model. Pink dots are the training data, green dots are the validation data. The validation data is either new data if using from_new_data or the original validation data if using from_final_val_data.

Parameters:

  • which_data (str) ‚Äì Either ‚Äúfrom_new_data‚Äù or ‚Äúfrom_final_val_data‚Äù.

  • model (nn.Module) ‚Äì The trained model.

  • X (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The data to plot.

  • y (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì The labels for the data.

__init__()[source]ÔÉÅ
classmethod from_new_data(model, params, data_file_suffix='_test', checkpoint_file_suffix=None)[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

data_file_suffix (str) ‚Äì Suffix for the data file e.g. _test means that the source files are params["tabular1_source_test], params["tabular2_source_test], params["img_source_test]. Change this to whatever suffix you have chosen for your new data files.
